alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 01 at 11:58AM MST until January 01 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Northwest Plateau, Northwest Highlands, West Central Mountains, and West Central Highlands. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong cross winds on area roadways. Gusty winds will create wind chill values in the single digits to teens. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers will be intermittent through the afternoon hours across portions of western New Mexico. Though no significant accumulations are expected, visibility may be poor at times.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains
